response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}

Explanation:
You're creating a new `dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator()` in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the `Iterator.next()` inside the loop. This will give you the correct value for each iteration and avoid getting the same value multiple times.
